meanings.definition: The act of throwing a quoit.
meanings.sent1: During the quoiting competition, he aimed carefully and threw the metal ring.
meanings.sent2: At the park, children enjoy quoiting by tossing the ring back and forth.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a quoiting match, with everyone trying to outdo each other.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the air as she excelled in the quoiting game.
meanings.sent5: The sound of metal quoiting through the air was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A game in which quoits are thrown at a stake in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The backyard party featured a lively quoiting tournament with friends aiming for the stake.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, quoiting was a popular pastime in many villages.
meanings.sent3: The competitive spirit was high as the neighbors gathered for a friendly game of quoiting.
meanings.sent4: The sun set on the horizon as the final round of quoiting began.
meanings.sent5: The clinking sound of quoits hitting the stake signaled the start of the game.

meanings.definition: To play the game of quoits.
meanings.sent1: They spent the afternoon quoiting in the backyard, enjoying the sunny weather.
meanings.sent2: After work, he liked to relax by quoiting with his colleagues at the park.
meanings.sent3: She quoited with such enthusiasm that she accidentally knocked over the stake.
meanings.sent4: The friends planned to quoit together every weekend to stay active.
meanings.sent5: Quoiting together brought them closer as they laughed and cheered each other on.
